features: Designed for PC, Mac, and Tablet (check compatibility at Toshiba's Consumer HDD website).
Versatile design. Includes USB-C and USB-A cables.
body.description: Combining compatibility and portability, the Canvio Flex portable external hard drive is designed to work interchangeably with most major USB devices and operating systems. The Canvio Flex is compatible with both Mac and Windows PC, as well as supported tablet devices with USB-C port (2). Enjoy the convenience and flexibility for your storage needs with the Canvio Flex - your smart storage companion.[Note]:(1) One Terabyte (1TB) means 10{12] = 1,000,000,000,000 bytes using powers of 10. Actual formatted storage capacity may vary. For details, please visit Toshiba's Consumer HDD website.(2) Compatibility may vary depending on user‘s hardware configuration and operating system. Reformatting may be required for use with Apple Time Machine. Please check compatibility list at Toshiba's Consumer HDD website.(4) Product specifications, colors, features, and availability are subject to change without notice. Product images may not reflect the actual product.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Key Features Cross-Device Compatibility(2) Connection where it counts. The Canvio Flex Portable External Hard Drive is formatted for Windows PC, Mac, as well as compatible iPad and Android tablet devices with USB-C port(2) enabling seamless file access right out of the box. Versatile Storage Stay ahead of the curve with the Canvio Flex Portable External Hard Drive, connecting directly to any compatible USB-equipped device(2). With both USB-A and USB-C cables included, you have the flexibility to easily connect to either old or new devices without the need for a USB adapter. Simple Elegance Flexible storage meets flexible style with a sleek, satin silver finish and lightweight design that complements your Mac, Windows PC, and compatible tablet devices(2).

Canvio Flex Portable External Hard Drive You aren't limited to just one device, and your storage solution shouldn't be, either. Combining compatibility and portability, the Canvio Flex Portable External Hard Drive is the cross-device storage solution built for your adaptable lifestyle. Designed to work interchangeably with most major USB device platforms and operating systems(2), the Canvio Flex makes transferring your files easier than ever, with up to 4TB(1) of storage capacity to safely store your data.

Cross-Device Compatibility(2) Formatted and works interchangeably with Windows PC, Mac, as well as compatible iPad and Android tablet devices with USB-C port(2) out of the box (check device compatibility at Toshiba’s Consumer HDD website). Storage On-The-Go Up to 4TB(1) of storage capacity in a portable & lightweight design meant for storage on-the-go. The elegant satin silver finish stylishly complements your Mac, PC, and compatible tablet devices(2). USB-C and USB-A Cables Included Versatile compatibility for new and older devices - directly connect to any compatible USB-A and USB-C device(2). USB 3.0 & 2.0 Compatible USB technology allows high speed data transfer with no external AC power cord needed. Cross-Device Compatibility Storage On-The-Go USB-C and USB-A Cables Included USB 3.0 & 2.0 Compatible

Canvio Flex Canvio Gaming Canvio Slim Canvio Advance Canvio Basics Versatile design, Cross-device compatibility(2) Sleek design, Portable game storage Slim design, Ultra-portable backup & security Stylish design, Backup & security Classic design, Plug&Play storage Capacities(1) 1TB, 2TB, 4TB 1TB, 2TB, 4TB 1TB, 2TB 1TB, 2TB, 4TB 1TB, 2TB, 4TB Casing Satin finish Satin finish Aluminum Textured finish Matte finish Colors Silver Black Black, Silver Black, White, Red, Green Black Compatibility(2) USB-C, USB 3.0/2.0 USB 3.0/2.0 USB 3.0/2.0 USB 3.0/2.0 USB 3.0/2.0 Works with(2) PC/Mac/Tablet PC/Mac/Game Console PC/Mac (reformatting required for Mac) PC/Mac (reformatting required for Mac) PC/Mac (reformatting required for Mac) Auto backup software (for Windows) ✓ ✓ Password protection software (for Windows) ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Robust and Flexible, A Dream Come True for Storage Enthusiasts! ★★★★★ (5/5)
reviews.reviewText: Happiness is finding a hard drive that works awesome and looks damn good 2. Below you will know the reasons why the Toshiba Canvio Flex is the best purchase I have ever made for my beautiful CPU. (MBP2020 OS: SONOMA 14.0)There's a lot to appreciate about the Toshiba Canvio Flex 1TB Portable External Hard Drive. Toshiba is a well-established and reputable brand in the world of technology, and with this particular product, they certainly don't disappoint.Design and PortabilityThe Canvio Flex is compact and lightweight, making it incredibly portable. The sleek design also means it looks as good as it performs. It's very easy to carry around, perfect for those who are always on the move. The silver casing feels durable and sturdy, a sure sign of a high-quality product.Compatibility and FlexibilityPerhaps the greatest strength of the Canvio Flex is its compatibility. The drive comes with both USB-C and USB 3.0 connectivity, which means it can be easily plugged into virtually any device, whether it's a PC, Mac, or even your smartphone. The transition between devices is seamless, and the flexibility this provides is a huge plus point.PerformanceWhen it comes to performance, the Canvio Flex shines. With USB 3.0, data transfer rates are rapid and smooth. The 1TB storage capacity is more than enough for most personal or professional needs. Whether you're storing large files, doing regular backups, or just want a safe place to keep your photos and videos, this drive has got you covered.Setup and UsabilityThe setup is pretty straightforward. It's plug-and-play with no complicated procedures or software installations required. It is preformatted for Windows and Mac, which saves time and effort. The LED light indicator also helps keep track of your data transfers.ReliabilityOne thing I appreciate about Toshiba products is their reliability. Based on my usage so far, the Canvio Flex has lived up to that reputation. With Toshiba's years of expertise in the field of storage technology, I'm confident that this drive will serve me well for a long time.ConclusionThe Toshiba Canvio Flex 1TB Portable External Hard Drive offers a wonderful blend of design, compatibility, performance, and ease of use. It's a versatile storage solution that is perfect for a variety of uses. Whether you're a student, a professional, or a casual user, this external hard drive is a product worth considering. At its price point, it offers excellent value for money, making it a smart investment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to transfer all my photos from my phone. I love how small and portable it is that I'm able to take it with me on the road. Transfer rate is fast. The price is right as well. If I'm in need of another external hard drive, I'd buy this again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars excellent little back up disk
reviews.reviewText: Convenient small size fit in shirt packet. 2 terabytes space, easy to use, no formatting required.Just plug it in and you're ready to go. Reasonable price too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great with MacOS
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had this hard drive set up for about 3 months now and I’ve had absolutely no problems with it connecting to my MacBook Air. I’d also like to mention it can store large 4K GoPro videos no problem, if that was any concern. If your looking for an external hard drive that’s compatible with MacOS this is the hard drive for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Learn about specs before you buy
reviews.reviewText: Love the flexibility this product offers, I'm able to plug it into Phone, iPad, or PC and preserve the quality of the photos.I'm at a point of confusion and a bit of frustration but I'd still recommend this to others as it's portable, convenient and serves its main purpose.Please approach the rest of commentary with the understanding that I'm very new to photo storage and upgraded from Google photos to this toshiba hard drive to preserve my raw photos. I have minimal understanding of hard drive technology and specs.My challenge is.....data transfer takes a lot longer than I anticipated/hoped.It's excruciatingly slow trying to open, view, and organize photos on my iPad. So much so that on an 11 hour flight, I wasn't able to accomplish anything.It's faster with my laptop, which makes sense to this non tech expert. That being said, it's still really pretty slow and laggy when reading it. Transfer of photos from SD card to hard drive took a pretty long time, I did it in 2 phases, maybe 30 gb each time. Would love to figure out the math on what I should expect that transfer to take, maybe my expectations were too high.I don't know anything about specs, I wish I had before I bought and wish I did now. I assumed that if it can STORE 2TB of data, that it should have no problem reading 74 gb worth of items at a fair speed so I can organize them into folders. As I simply view them on my laptop, It also doesn't seem to keep them loaded as I scroll down, and it is an arduous process to group them.Maybe I'm meant to transfer the photos to the computer first and look at them there, and then transfer them back? Is that how to make this work better? I'll be doing some research in my spare time.Biggest complaint - if it is such a difficult task to open up and load all the photos at once in the main folder where they default, can there be an easier way to group them into separate folders to reduce this pain point? Maybe an auto folder based on date, or all photos from 5000-6000 in one. Maybe I'll look into a software that organizes them as this is painful. I don't know if it is possible to organize the photos ahead of time from the SD card before transferring when on the go - or if I should just rethink my process all together.Other context - I've confirmed my laptop processing capabilities are not the issue, it is the specs of the hard drive (confirmed by tech support from laptop team). HP Elitebook, new in last 5 years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hasn’t died yet
reviews.reviewText: Maybe it’s just me, but I’ve had four external hard drives similar to this one, and they’ve all died within about a year to a year and a half. This one is still going and provides a lot of storage for the space it takes up on your desktop (and the price you pay). Although I’ve had zero problems with it, my experience with other external drives (none by this manufacturer) tells me not to trust any external drive as the only place you store things that are important to you. Just sayin’…But drives like this are great for retrieving the document you inadvertently deleted yesterday. Also, the USB-C connectivity is great for use with recent computers, which use that standard..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, quality product.
reviews.reviewText: Been using it for a few weeks and I am very pleased - no issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Had some issues with formatting other ext HD for my MacBook. This Toshiba 4TB HD was simple plug and play. Very impressed. Great price- same day delivery.
